intro: Anredera vesicaria, commonly known as the air plant or bubble plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Commelinaceae. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves that form a rosette shape, and it produces small, inconspicuous flowers. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found growing on trees or rocks. Anredera vesicaria is also known for its ability to propagate through runners, making it a common ornamental plant in subtropical regions.
